Topic.Title: whose crane got toppled in NYC?

Message.Msg: Frasier's crane has left the building!

"Any thoughts on what Timber / Concrete companies will be main suppliers for the aftermath of hurricane sandy?" Damage was limited. Long term reconstruction won't add much demand compared to a slight pick-up in housing prices which is already causing a timber shortage since mills won't reopen until it is clear the market is on a long term up trend. Add in the fact that much of the western timber stock is being killed by pine beetles so that harvest will be reduced and there isn't much there. Plum Creak may be one option. But, until more mills open and the pine beetles writeoffs are taken, I'm not hot on it. Plum Creek used to have a great dividend though. I don't think there will be much additional demand for concrete. Home Depot and Loews would have been stock to stock up on before the storm, but I think they would be selling off today if the markets were open since people have already loaded their pantry. I think the story here is that there isn't much of a story. .

Message.Title: THANKS UNKb on IV #31344 important update***
Message.Msg: HJD yesterday morning (or so I heard, and I'm obviously paraphrasing - but closely): "Your honor, this motion was designed to circumvent the authority of your court by transferring responsibility for confirming validity of the patents from federal court to the PTO - there's no other way to interpret it" ***In re. Apple not having anyone to handle invalidity, I believe that all along that was Cisco/Desmarais' task in the joint defense. The trials were separated only a month or so ago, and I doubt someone from Williams' firm could pick up the baton of many months of work on Desmarais' part, hence the use of Desmarais to make the argument in the Apple case as well. I doubt that HJD will grant VHC's motion for collateral estoppel on Desmarais' participation, and if he does I'm not sure that Cisco will allow him to argue for Apple, but it very well might - he's ready to make the arguments (one assumes), and one jury is the same as another. To the extent that Desmarais establishes the patents as invalid in front of an Apple jury, that's significant precedent to establish the same in front of a Cisco jury. As I have no "Esq" behind my name, at this point it's above my pay grade, that's just speculation.

Message.Title: If I had a choice
Message.Msg: between the fascist censoring Yahoo that we have today and a Yahoo that allowed free speech, I believe that I would choose the free speech Yahoo and never read the fascist censoring Yahoo. Howevre, we do not have a choice. We only have the fascist Yahoo that stifles free speech and censors all posts that the money powers would not like.
